patterns: can i change my feeling of being worthless to everyone?
i barely sleep and i do nothing but think about how i'm worthless and how i shouldn't be here.
i've always wanted to fix my issues, but i never get around to it.
how can i change my feeling of being worthless to everyone?
responses: Because your surroundings define who you are, if everyone believes that you are worthless, you might want to look for new people with whom to hang out.

the social context in which a person lives is a big influence in self-esteem; you can go round and round trying to understand why you're not worthless, then go back to the same crowd and be knocked down again.

A person's self-esteem is significantly influenced by the social environment in which they live; you can go endlessly round attempting to comprehend the reason why you're not useless, then, at that point, return to a similar group and be thumped down once more.
If everyone thinks you're worthless, maybe you should find new people to hang out with because your surroundings define who you are.
